title: Associate HR Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter reached out to me very quickly via email, after I applied online to schedule an initial phone interview. The phone screen was super informative, and went really well. We quickly scheduled an interview with the hiring manager. The hiring manager interview was over Google Meet. It went extremely well. The hiring manager was very transparent and expectations of what was expected of the successful candidate were laid out. Significant time was set aside for me to ask questions. Lastly, I had a panel interview, which like the first two rounds, went very smoothly. I sent in my references and received an offer shortly after. The recruiter is the one scheduling the interviews and doing the reaching out, and she was incredible. An interview tips sheet is provided before every round, which was helpful. Overall, a very smooth and efficient process.
Interview Questions: Very thoughtful and thorough interview. The tips sheet provided is really incredible. They ask your behavior/STAR questions, as about previous work, etc.

title: Job Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities
Interview Descriptions: Had a couple of interviews. Took them a very long time to get in touch with me since my application then didn't get back to me after my last interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to CEO?

title: Strategy Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: HR will reach out regarding interview scheduling 30 min screening interview with Manager Assignment to evaluate technical skills (data analytics, critical thinking, communication) Panel Interviews with prospective team members Final offer letter
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions (Tell me about a time when..) Technical Questions

title: Job Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Every person was super open, conversational, and welcoming! The process only took a few weeks. I am very excited to move forward with the Center for Employment Opportunities. Overall a positive experience.
Interview Questions: What past experience has prepared you for this role?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities
Interview Descriptions:
There was a telephone interview and an in-person interview. The telephone interview went fine but with the in-person interview, it really didn't seem the interviewer knew what the company needed in a hire for the position. The interview went well and there were talks of contact and further steps in the interview process. 

After writing a thank you email for the in-person interview, and a follow up email one week later, I heard no response whatsoever from the company.

I'm glad to know early on that they don't take their word seriously, rather than later.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities (New York, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview, a 2-3 hour "assignment" and an in-person panel interview, they never responded.... and I later learned that the entire team I interviewed with had moved on to new jobs.
Interview Questions: Technical questions about building email marketing strategy

title: Intern - Hourly Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities (New York, NY) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: A lady took me into a conference room and asked questions about how I handle situations at a workplace and how do I organize my workload.  It was a calm environment but some of the questions were very similar to each other it felt repetitive.
Interview Questions: When was a time you were faced with a challenge?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities
Interview Descriptions: Two video interviews and one in person interview. Very conversational. Not intense.  This company seems highly organized, with evidence based work.  I am excited about the opportunity and am glad I applied.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your interest in this job?

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have an interview it was a group orientation that lasted for two days and we started working soon after that. They gave us a book,boots, and a couple of pages front in back to different sites we plung in at. This only last for 75 days.

title: Job Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews.One was with the direct manager of the position. The second was with the director. They asked formal and informal. Be yourself and express how you plan on assisting thers in reaching their goal. Training is given when hired.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a resistant person?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. First I had a phone interview, then two in-person meetings. The person that interviewed me continually interrupted me, didn't listen, and kept saying I wasn't good for the job. Then why did you invite me in...? I explained why I was interested, was told I was one of the finalist, but never heard back after the last interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Maintenance Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Center For Employment Opportunities (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was intense and very active they asked very questions and made me feel very comfortable. They also made sure to provide refreshments,it was very informal and they behaved with respect and dignity. I felt very respected it was a great experience for me and I appreciate having the opportunity to work with these guys.
Interview Questions: How will you improve the company?
